newsitem.title: USA: Reliance unit lifts Human Genome stake.
newsitem.headline: Reliance unit lifts Human Genome stake.

text.p: Reliance Financial Services Corp said it increased its stake in Human Genome Sciences to 12.8 percent from 11.8 percent.
In a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, Reliance said it bought 70,000 additional shares of Human Genome between August 21 and 30 at prices ranging from $34 to $34.125 a share.
It said it held 2,381,624 shares of the Rockville, Md.-based company, which explores human, microbial and plant genes aimed at developing products to detect and treat diseases.
New York-based Reliance is a unit of Reliance Group Holdings Inc, in which investor Saul Steinberg and his family own a 45 percent stake.
